p:
William Bradley & O.J. Anderson whose names are subscribed to the foregoing bond as sureties being first duly sworn, each for himself on oath says: that he is a resident of Washington Territory; that he is not a counsels
attorney at law, sheriff, clerk or other officer of the District Court, and that he is worth the sum of three hundred dollars one and above all debts and liabilities and exclusion of proper by exempt from execution
Subscribed & sworn to, before me, this 11th day of December, 1884}
